pages.text: Herbs are an essential part of Roots. They are required in crafting, in rituals and in the creation & casting of spells.$(br2)The first herbs you are likely to discover are found when breaking ferns and grass: $(l:herbs/terra_moss)terra spores$() and $(l:herbs/wildroot)wildroot$().$(br2)These are also important ingredients used in many early recipes and rituals.

While you could spend time breaking grass in order to build up a large supply of these herbs, there are alternatives.$(br2)$(l:herbs/terra_moss)Terra Moss$() is the only herb that does not grow on soil of some description, but the $(l:rituals/ritual_overgrowth)Overgrowth Ritual$() does make it renewable.$(br2)Besides the elemental herbs, $(l:herbs/infernal_bulb)Infernal Bulb$(), $(l:herbs/dewgonia)Dewgonia$(), $(l:herbs/cloud_berry)Cloud Berry$() and $(l:herbs/stalicripe)Stalicripe$(), all can be grown as crops on normal farmland.

This allows for an early, renewable source of $(l:herbs/wildroot)Wildroot$().$(br2)A few herbs, $(l:herbs/spirit_herb)Spirit Herb$(), $(l:herbs/pereskia)Pereskia$(), and $(l:herbs/wildewheet)Wildewheet$() must be crafted into seeds before they can be replanted.$(br2)Elemental herbs must be grown on elemental soil, although their types needn't match.

pages.title: Unlocking Herbs
pages.text: You will not immediately be able to access all herbs upon starting Roots. A number of them require use of a specific tool, while others require a crafting ritual on Pyre.$(br2)The recipe for each herb is specified in its entry, and can be crafted as many times as you like.$(br2)$(info) It is always worthwhile to grow herbs as crops after initial crafting.
